attributes.action: Make every patient pay one pound towards GP funding when making an appointment.
attributes.additional_details: The average GP sees more than 40 patients daily and only for a short period of time. This puts a health risk as the practitioner may not have enough time to see those who have a worrying health risk. Due to this, GP faces mounting pressures of increased, demand, unmanageable workloads and lack of resources causing more to leave the profession. Giving a pound when making an appointment will increase investment towards GP so more doctors can be recruited to see patients carefully and with no rush.
attributes.background: According to the British Medical Association (BMA), England will lose more than 600 GP practices by 2022 without urgent investment. although the government has a long-term funding plan, at this point only 7.1% of NHS budget is spent on GP funding. Paying a pound, can increase investment towards GP.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You may want to consider starting a petition that calls on the Government to implement a charge for making a doctor's appointment to be used for a specific purpose, such as increasing the number of GPs. 

We also require petitioners to provide a full name when submitting a petition.
